title: How to Transfer Replays from Super Smash Bros. Ultimate to PC

steps.title: Go to the main menu.
steps.content: Go to the main menu. Go to Vault, then Replays, then Replay Data.

steps.title: Select the replay you want to transfer to your PC later.
steps.content: Select the replay you want to transfer to your PC later. Select Convert to Video.

steps.title: Select options if desired.
steps.content: Select options if desired. You will be given four additional options before you commence the conversion to video: playing sound effects, playing background music, displaying the HUD, and a choice between Normal or Pretty quality. Pretty quality videos look better, but there is a limit to how much footage can be recorded in Pretty quality, and the video will take up more space on your microSD card.

steps.title: Choose a name for your reply.
steps.content: Choose a name for your reply. Press + when prompted to begin playback and conversion. It is recommended that you hide the recording guide first by pressing up and X.

steps.title: Wait for the replay to finish.
steps.content: Wait for the replay to finish. Once the replay finishes, the video conversion will be complete, and the replay's video will be saved to your microSD card.

steps.title: Shut down the Switch first before removing the microSD card to prevent data corruption.
steps.content: Shut down the Switch first before removing the microSD card to prevent data corruption.

steps.title: Plug the microSD card via microSD converter into your PC's SD card slot.
steps.content: Plug the microSD card via microSD converter into your PC's SD card slot. The SD card will appear on your PC. Double-click on it, and follow this path: Nintendo > Album > Extra > 0E7DF678130F4F0FA2C88AE72B47AFDF > XXXX (year) > YY (month) > ZZ (day).

steps.title: Wait for the replay to appear as an MP4 file.
steps.content: Wait for the replay to appear as an MP4 file. Copy it onto your PC from here.

steps.title: Return your microSD card to the Switch.
steps.content: Return your microSD card to the Switch. Be sure to right-click on the microSD card on your PC and select Eject before removing it to prevent data corruption.
